view_context()

An instance of a view class. The default view class is ActionView::Base

The view class must have the following methods: View.new[lookup_context, assigns, controller] 

  Create a new ActionView instance for a controller

View#render[options] 

  Returns String with the rendered template

Override this method in a module to change the default behavior.

[ show source ]

_normalize_args(action=nil, options={})

Normalize options by converting render “foo” to render :action => “foo” and render “foo/bar“ to render :file => “foo/bar“.

[ show source ]

       # File actionpack/lib/abstract_controller/rendering.rb, line 137
137:     def _normalize_args(action=nil, options={})
138:       case action
139:       when NilClass
140:       when Hash
141:         options, action = action, nil
142:       when String, Symbol
143:         action = action.to_s
144:         key = action.include?(//) ? :file : :action
145:         options[key] = action
146:       else
147:         options.merge!(:partial => action)
148:       end
149: 
150:       options
151:     end
_normalize_options(options)

[ show source ]

       # File actionpack/lib/abstract_controller/rendering.rb, line 153
153:     def _normalize_options(options)
154:       if options[:partial] == true
155:         options[:partial] = action_name
156:       end
157: 
158:       if (options.keys & [:partial, :file, :template]).empty?
159:         options[:prefix] ||= _prefix
160:       end
161: 
162:       options[:template] ||= (options[:action] || action_name).to_s
163:       options
164:     end

view_assigns()

This method should return a hash with assigns. You can overwrite this configuration per controller. :api: public

[ show source ]

       # File actionpack/lib/abstract_controller/rendering.rb, line 127
127:     def view_assigns
128:       hash = {}
129:       variables  = instance_variable_names
130:       variables -= protected_instance_variables if respond_to?(:protected_instance_variables)
131:       variables.each { |name| hash[name.to_s[1..1]] = instance_variable_get(name) }
